intro: Torularia contortuplicata, commonly known as the twisted mullein, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense cluster at the tip of its stems. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands or rocky areas. Torularia contortuplicata is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
